page.title: 03Holtball Farm
page.content: Holtball Farm is the only part of our area below about 500 feet above sea level. It is in Luccombe parish and has more in common with rectangle 02920144. The farm is rented out by the National Trust (Holnicote Estate). The Estate was given to the Nation by Sir Richard Acland in 1948. The farm is 200 acres (80 hectares). Itis an all grass farm. They keep about 30 cows, mostly Devon and Fresian, and a Charolais bull. They have also about 10 pigs, 35 hens, 2 dogs, 3 cats and some sheep. The land is Quite good quality and is mostly Red Sandstone.
